content: The Act is titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms used within the Act. The "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" defines key terms such as Authority, Griffith Project, Secretary, and Acquired Land(s). The "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" defines key terms including Secretary (Secretary of the Interior), Acquired Land(s) (land interests acquired by the United States), Public Land (lands under Federal ownership), and Withdrawn Land (Federal lands reserved for specific purposes). The "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" defines key terms including Secretary, Acquired Land(s), Public Land, and Withdrawn Land. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE OF GRIFFITH PROJECT. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348. The Secretary will convey all rights, title, and interest in project improvements, facilities, acquired lands, and reserved interests to the Authority. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348. The Secretary will convey all rights, title, and interest in project improvements, facilities, acquired lands, and reserved interests to the Authority. Additionally, the Authority shall have a right-of-way across Public Land and Withdrawn Land for the operation and maintenance of the Griffith Project without payment of rental or fees. The Secretary and the Authority will agree on a description of the land for the rights-of-way established. The Secretary must provide a document memorializing the rights-of-way. If the conveyance does not occur within twelve months, a report on the status must be submitted to Congress. The Secretary and the Authority may modify existing contracts and land permits to comply with this Act. This Act does not affect other laws or future benefits. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, it will no longer receive Reclamation benefits and will cease to be a Federal Reclamation Project. Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area associated lands will not be affected. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area associated lands will not be affected. The Act does not impact the National Park Service's authority to manage the area. Federal reclamation law will still apply to water delivered to the Authority under contracts with the Secretary. After conveyance, the United States will not be liable for damages related to the conveyed property.
